body:
I could see it being useful to have a way for packages to identify the correct way to cite the package in literature and to have Spack be able to produce a bibtex file for a given set of packages.

```
spack -cite foo
```

Would produce a bibtex file (or equiv.) for foo and all its dependencies.

This would probably require a new package directive such as

```
citing(author = 'Jean César', title = 'An amazing title', year = '2013',
    month = 'jan', volume = '12', pages = '12--23', journal = 'Nice Journal')
```
title: Support software package citation
